title: Blockprocessing freezes, rpc remains responsive
body:
Running on Ubuntu 18.04 with commit 0f24a01

I compiled the latest, let it sync the gap and then hooked it to RPC queries.
After some 12h aprox this is how the log looks like : 

```
INFO [09-12|12:43:33.009] Sync stage 8/12. Generate account history index...
INFO [09-12|12:43:33.033] Sync stage 9/12. Generate storage history index...
INFO [09-12|12:43:33.063] Sync stage 10/12. Generate tx lookup index...
INFO [09-12|12:43:33.096] Sync stage 11/12. Update transaction pool...
INFO [09-12|13:29:47.488] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [09-12|14:29:47.488] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [09-12|15:29:47.488] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [09-12|16:29:47.489] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [09-12|17:29:47.488] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [09-12|18:29:47.488] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [09-12|19:29:47.488] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [09-12|20:29:47.491] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [09-12|21:29:47.488] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [09-12|22:29:47.488] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
```

So it's not catching up any more blocks and every hour it has the "regenerated" message.  No crash, no errors, just seems to have frozen.

Meanwhile the rpcdaemon runs via the tg process with private.api and still responds.  It's actually processing quite a load.

The process is still running as is, let me know if there's any useful information i can extract for patching, before i hit restart.
Thanks for reporting. Could you send `kill -6` to the process - it will quit, but it will send the stack trace. I would love to see the stack trace of when it hangs
